title: Sion ult doesn't go through Azir ult.
body: I don't think this is supposed to happen. {{champion:268}}  ult is supposed to be a wall against enemies, not allies. so then why does {{champion:14}}  ult collide with a friendly {{champion:268}} ult as if it were a {{champion:59}} Cataclism or {{champion:34}}  wall? if this is not intentional it should be fixed. or if it is intentional can someone explain to me why they would do that?

replies.body:
It collides with a friendly Azir wall?

Yeah thats a bug
I thought so! I threw so many team fights because I would ult as {{champion:268}}  and block my ally {{champion:14}}  thanks!
Yes this is fixed in the next patch.
Aren't 'Unstoppable' abilities like Malphite's ult supposed to be able to go through Azir's ult? So wouldn't Sions?

Yeah, you're right my friend. But the problem here is that **"Unstoppable" or not,** an ally should **always** passed through Azir's Soldiers Devide with ease. In this case, we're talking about a friendly Sion that can't ult through an allied Azir ult... And this is indeed, quite odd. 

In an other hand, YES, **unstoppable** skills should run through the Shurima Emperor's ult and I didn't saw a recent bug on this when playing Sion jungler or Malphite against an Azir. No worries on that.
Last I checked Sion couldn't run through Azir ult at all, but I might be mistaken, maybe I saw this bug on youtube and didn't know. Thanks, though.
Np, have fun playing ! :)

Actually, if it's an enemy sion running into an ally azir ult then the enemy sion will treat the azir ult like normal terrain(or should at least) just like how anivia's wall will stop sion from ulting.
I didn't know! Thank you for the information :)

Chalk another glorious interaction up to Riot's focus on "Clarity".

"Azir's ult won't block unstoppable movement" - *proceeds to make a movement based ultimate with 'Unstoppable' in the name that's blocked*

"Cassiopeia's Twin Fangs doesn't have a cooldown when it attacks a poisoned enemy, even if an ally poisoned then" - *ignores Gangplank's passive and Shaco's shiv, despite both claiming to be poison*

"Yasuo can only use his ultimate on airborne enemies" - *never defines airborne, when the in game definition is very different from the common definition* 

I'm sure there's more I'm forgetting, but it's pretty bad.
i saw further down in this post something about {{champion:14}} ult being stopped by {{champion:35}}  boxes and {{champion:268}} soldiers. has this been looked into as well?
I think it's a problem on Sion's end, actually. His ultimate interacts with terrain, and Azir's ult is probably considered terrain for Sion's ult.
which makes very little sense with how it actually functions. it blocks dashes but speeds allies up. would be interesting to get riot in on this.

I can verify this, the same happened to me.  I was Sion, and I kept colliding with my teammate Azir's wall during my ult.

There is also a game-breaking bug with Sion which causes his Q and R to be un-usable until you exit the LoL.exe and reconnect.  Happened to me when I tried to Q, but then got warwick ulted and killed during the duration.  I came alive with my passive, tried to kill someone, didn't.  When I respawned, I was unable to use my Q or R whatsoever.  I could still use my W and E.

This seems to happen occasionally. When you use a channeled spell and get interrupted, it sometimes breaks ad doesn't let you use it for the rest of the game. It's happened to me with Xerath before, and I've heard of numerous cases with Vi.

Its a bug because with Azirs ult it counts as Terrain for the enemy team, for the team who has the Azir its basically a speed boost gate. Imagine an Anivia Wall that gave you Frosty tracks or something, for enemies it slows, but for you it gives you 10% extra movement speed plus anyone following you gets slowed by 20% Sion's ult if collided with terrain stops it, its a bug and it can be a really broken one. Because if timed poorly it can ruin a team fight, or if timed properly it can destroy in a team fight.
